messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the Spring Boot (Spring MVC / Spring ecosystem) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `src/main/java/io/github/proxyprint/kitchen/controllers/notifications/NotificationsController.java`, I found that `io.github.proxyprint.kitchen.controllers.notifications.NotificationsController.deleteNotification` is implemented to process HTTP requests to the path `/notifications/{notificationId}`. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
- Full HTTP request path
  /notifications/{notificationId}

- All HTTP methods acceptable
  false

- HEAD
  false

- POST
  false

- OPTIONS
  false

- TRACE
  false

- GET
  false

- PUT
  true

- DELETE
  true

- PATCH
  false

Explanation
- The controller class has no class-level @RequestMapping, so the method-level paths are used as written.
- deleteNotification is annotated with @RequestMapping(value="/notifications/{notificationId}", method = RequestMethod.DELETE) â€” that defines the DELETE method for the path.
- There is another handler in the same controller with the same path annotated with method = RequestMethod.PUT (readNotification), so PUT is also explicitly supported for /notifications/{notificationId}.
- No handler for this path is declared without a method attribute (which would allow all methods), so "all methods" is false.
- Per your instruction to base acceptability on the code (not on framework runtime behavior), automatic framework handling (e.g., automatic HEAD for GET or automatic OPTIONS response) is not counted; therefore HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE, GET, POST, PATCH are false.
